title: Gauss law - what must be true when flux is zero

content.question: Which of the following statements is always true for a Gaussian surface through which the total electric flux is zero?

choices.label: There are no charged objects inside the surface.
The net charge enclosed by the surface is zero, but charged objects could still be inside the surface.
The electric field is zero everywhere on the surface.
At every location on the surface, the electric field is either zero, perpendicular to the surface, or parallel to the surface.

content.answer: The net charge enclosed by the surface is zero, but charged objects could still be inside the surface.
